sentences.en: " How could it make me tipsy, Pa?
sentences.cn: " 它怎能让我醉着呢, 爸?

sentences.en: But they were not only tipsy; it was plain that they were furiously angry.
sentences.cn: 他们不仅喝醉了, 而且显然还怒气冲冲.

sentences.en: He was a bit tipsy, reeling along the street.
sentences.cn: 他已有几分醉意, 沿大街蹒跚而行.

sentences.en: He, too, was tipsy and his explanations were repetitive.
sentences.cn: 他自己也喝醉了,他反复地解释.

sentences.en: Jastrow's glance at her was sly and tipsy.
sentences.cn: 贾斯特罗微带醉意地偷偷瞅着她.

sentences.en: Now, we won't submit to impertinence from these pimply, tipsy virgins.
sentences.cn: 现在我们决不能忍受这群长着脓包 、 喝醉了的小兔崽子们的无礼举动.

sentences.en: On my day off, I'll fix the tipsy fence.
sentences.cn: 我歇班那天就修理歪了的篱笆.

sentences.en: Pen stopped his tipsy remonstrances by telling him to told his tongue.
sentences.cn: 潘不让他带着醉意申辩下去,告诉他立即住口.

sentences.en: She laughed an ugly laugh. " Tipsy?
The wine has made him a trifle tipsy.
sentences.cn: 这酒喝得他有点醉意了.

sentences.en: They stick out all over him, like almonds in a tipsy cake.
sentences.cn: 它们从他身上往外戳, 好象醉蛋糕上的杏仁.

sentences.en: They tipsy men and women yelled with delight.
sentences.cn: 那些男女醉客都快活得叫喊起来.

sentences.en: We were at a particularly tipsy table.
sentences.cn: 我们这一桌的人喝得特别醉.

trans.tran_cn: 喝醉的，由醉引起的，不稳的，歪斜的
